---
title: "Statistical models"
editor: visual
bibliography: references.bib
---



::: {.callout-note appearance="simple"}
This is a work in progress that is currently undergoing heavy technical editing and copy-editing
:::



::: {.cell hash='yieldloss-regression-models_cache/pdf/unnamed-chunk-1_9790d1888d7ceef84d727f2a272d3dd7'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
theme_set(theme_bw(base_size = 16))
wm <- read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/emdelponte/paper-white-mold-meta-analysis/gh-pages/dat-white-mold-br.csv")
```
:::

::: {.cell hash='yieldloss-regression-models_cache/pdf/unnamed-chunk-2_df3a0b73f236425cb1d1b3327fdc498d'}

```{.r .cell-code}
wm1 <- wm |> 
  select(study, inc, yld) |> 
  filter(study %in% c(1)) 
wm1
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 13 x 3
   study   inc   yld
   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
 1     1    76  2265
 2     1    53  2618
 3     1    42  2554
 4     1    37  2632
 5     1    29  2820
 6     1    42  2799
 7     1    55  2503
 8     1    40  2967
 9     1    26  2965
10     1    18  3088
11     1    27  3044
12     1    28  2925
13     1    36  2867
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='yieldloss-regression-models_cache/pdf/unnamed-chunk-3_695a694ee447f7e3da64595c53bfc769'}

```{.r .cell-code}
wm1 |> 
  ggplot(aes(inc, yld))+
  geom_point(size = 2)+
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = F, color = "black", fullrange = T)+
  ylim(1800, 3500)+
  labs(x = "White mold incidence (%)",
       y = "Soybean yield (kg/ha)",
       color = "Study")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](yieldloss-regression-models_files/figure-pdf/unnamed-chunk-3-1.pdf){fig-pos='H'}
:::
:::



Fitting a linear regression model



::: {.cell hash='yieldloss-regression-models_cache/pdf/unnamed-chunk-4_747b3bf4e8a04a8ac22b143810143603'}

```{.r .cell-code}
lm1 <-  lm(yld ~ inc, data = wm1) 
summary(lm1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Call:
lm(formula = yld ~ inc, data = wm1)

Residuals:
    Min      1Q  Median      3Q     Max 
-178.41  -44.70   14.60   49.34  206.18 

Coefficients:
            Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
(Intercept) 3329.142     86.844  38.335 4.60e-13 ***
inc          -14.208      2.076  -6.845 2.78e-05 ***
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

Residual standard error: 110.4 on 11 degrees of freedom
Multiple R-squared:  0.8099,	Adjusted R-squared:  0.7926 
F-statistic: 46.86 on 1 and 11 DF,  p-value: 2.782e-05
```
:::
:::



The damage curves can be expressed in relative terms. For this, we divide the slope by the intercept and multiply by 100.



::: {.cell hash='yieldloss-regression-models_cache/pdf/unnamed-chunk-5_7812d05e4693e901722b97a4698163aa'}

```{.r .cell-code}
slope <- -14.2/3329.14*100
x = seq(0,1,0.1)
y = seq(0,1,0.1)
dat <- data.frame(x,y)
dat |> 
  ggplot(aes(x,y))+
  geom_point(color = "white")+  
  geom_abline(aes(intercept = 1, slope = slope))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](yieldloss-regression-models_files/figure-pdf/unnamed-chunk-5-1.pdf){fig-pos='H'}
:::
:::
